issue.title: C++: ctest fails if Python 3 is the active Python interpreter
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-63](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-63). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
This is due to one of the test runner dependencies not working on Python 3. This should either be fixed or removed (asan_symbolize.py)

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-63?focusedCommentId=15213266) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
See patch: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/42

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-63?focusedCommentId=15213596) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Issue resolved by pull request 42
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/42>
